item.title: A Dystopian Story
Look what the cat dragged in.
item.description: “But I love you,” he pleads, eyes streaming and voice shaking; a mess of quaking limbs and blotched skin, dressed in dirty thirdhand rags and alley-cat hair, on his knees on the expensive carpet I had had selected and arranged just last week. I sniff, disgusted. Does he honestly expect his snivelling to make any difference to me? One would have thought heâ€™d know better by now at least. Gingerly, I brush at a trailing, fraying bit of cloth with a foot.
